article.content:
Galaxy will have a strong presence at Plant and Animal Genome XXIV (PAG 2017), being held in San Diego, California, United States, January 14-18. There is something (and often many things) every day of the conference.

Date Time Topic Session Links Contact
Saturday
January 14 		4:00-4:15 Data Stewardship in the Life Sciences Challenges and Opportunities in Plant Science Data Management, Pacific Salon 4-5 Robert Davey
Sunday
January 15 		8:10-8:30 The Genomics Education Partnership: An Introduction to Bioinformatics in a Course-based Undergraduate Research Experience (CURE) Resources and Programs for Undergraduate Education in Genomics, Towne - Meeting House Sarah Elgin
4:00-4:25 Tripal Introduction and Core Development Efforts Tripal Database Network and Initiatives, California Room Stephen P. Ficklin
4:55-5:10 CartograTree Workflows with Tripal API for Association Mapping in Forest Trees Tripal Database Network and Initiatives, California Room Nic Herndon
Monday
January 16 		10:00-11:30 P0330 DNAPOD: Implementation of Virtual Machine for DNAPOD Workflow and Genotype Imputation Poster Session: Even numbers Takako Mochizuki
P0358: TreeGenes and CartograTree: Genetic and Genomic Resources for Forest Trees and P0360: TreeGenes: Genetic and Genomic Resources for Forest Trees Emily Grau
P0390: AgronGalaxy: A Web-Based Server for Mining SNP Markers Using Reduced Representation Library Li-yu Daisy Liu
P0482: Discovery and Visualisation of Homologous Genes and Gene Families Using Galaxy Anil S. Thanki
3:00-4:30 P0381: The Genomics Education Partnership: An Introduction to Bioinformatics in a Course-based Undergraduate Research Experience (CURE) Poster Session: Odd numbers Sarah Elgin
P0445: CartograTree Workflows with Tripal API for Association Mapping in Forest Trees Nic Herndon
P0473: Enhancement of Data Searching, Visualization and Exploration in the Hardwood Genomics Database (HGD) by Integration of New Tripal Extensions and Galaxy Ming Chen
P0479: A Novel Tripal Database Module and Workflow to Facilitate Variant Mapping and Detection in Non-Model Plant Species Qiaoshan Lin
P0489: Web-Based Bioinformatics Workflows for RNA-Seq Data Analysis in Agricultural Animal Species Yuanyuan Chang
7:05-7:25 Jetstream: On-Demand Cloud Computing for Life Sciences Research and Education CyVerse - Software, Tools, and Services for Data-Driven Discovery, California Room Matthew Vaughn
Tuesday
January 17 		4:00-6:10 Genome Annotation with Galaxy Workshop, California Room Slides Jeremy Goecks
Wednesday
January 18 		1:35-2:00 Galaxy Community Update GMOD, Golden West [Slides](https://depot.galaxyproject.org/hub/attachments/documents/presentations/2017-pag-gmod-community-update.pdf) Dave Clements
2:00-2:25 Discovery and Visualisation of Homologous Genes and Gene Families Using Galaxy GMOD, Golden West Anil S. Thanki
